PolyPharma.GOInfoCirculation.PythonIsNotForOOP module¶

Created on Mar 25, 2013

@author: Andrei Kucharavy, achiffa @ github

This small example demonstrates why Python is NOT suited for Object Oriented Programming due to it’s random switching between referencing objects and new object creation

class PolyPharma.GOInfoCirculation.PythonIsNotForOOP.Person(name, children=[<Person('Josphine','6')>, <Person('Chloe','6')>, <Person('Baptiste','6')>, <Person('Joseph','6')>, <Person('Melissa','6')>, <Person('Jonny','6')>])[source]¶
addChild(childObject)[source]¶
